description:
Are you looking for a place to meet other trans folks in and around the Ann Arbor-Ypsilanti area? T-Time is a social gathering and safe space by trans people for trans people of all ages.

Starting the 4th Monday in January 2017, we'll be at Cultivate every month on the 4th Monday from 6-8 PM. The table will be reserved with a sign that reads "T-Time."

All trans, genderqueer, and questioning people are welcome in this space. FTM, MTF, agender, genderqueer, and any other trans identities are welcome! Minors are welcome to attend with or without a parent/guardian. Parents/guardians are welcome to stay with their child if needed. 

We'll be drinking coffee, tea, and beer (for those 21+). The space can be used however you want - board games, networking, or simply just hanging out. Cultivate offers some board games. They even welcome outside food!

At least one FTM A2 Ypsi representative will be in attendance at every T-Time. If you need resources, have questions to ask, or need someone to talk to, please do so with one of the representatives and not a participant unless they say otherwise. Trans people are often forced to educate others, even when they don't feel comfortable, so we don't want anyone to be placed in that kind of position.
name: T-Time

description:
Art Off The Wall 2016 is the Ann Arbor Art Center's BIGGEST Holiday Exhibition and Shopping Event ever! And it happens from NOVEMBER 19th 2016 to JANUARY 7th 2017

JOIN US FOR THE OPENING RECEPTION ON FRIDAY, NOVEMBER 18! (6 to 9pm) - This is a special reception/shopping event where members of the Ann Arbor Art Center will get discounts of up to 20%*

For the first time our first and second floors will become one giant gallery/shop where patrons will be able to purchase original, handmade works of art as holiday gifts, or to add to their personal art collection. Artwork is purchased directly “off the wall” for a fun and festive shopping experience!  

Come see the work of hundreds of artists, featuring paintings, textiles, ceramics, home decor, glass, jewelry, holiday ornaments, winter accessories, cards, handmade stuffed animals and much more!

To learn more about our holiday exhibition and the exclusive shopping event: https://goo.gl/IueiWi

*Discount excludes Motawi merchandise
----------
Sponsored by: Imagine Fitness and Yoga

The 117 Gallery 2016/ 2017 season is supported by Vintage Financial Services LLC
name: Art Off The Wall Holiday Exhibition & Shopping Event

description:
A2CT will hold a series of workshops on various aspects of stage production on Saturday, January 14 and Saturday, January 21, between 10am-2:30pm each day at the A2CT Studio, 322 West Ann Street, Ann Arbor, MI, 48104. As a part of Civic Theatre’s education series, these one-hour workshops will offer an overview of sound, lighting, set, props, make-up/hair, and costume design, as well as stage management. Each session will be led by local technical theater experts from A2CT, local colleges, and the acclaimed technical theater department at Community High School. The workshops are designed for those in grade 6 through adult, and those attending may attend any or all sessions. Each individual session is $5, or $20 for a pass for all sessions per day ($10 for A2CT members). Those interested may register by calling the A2CT office at 734-971-2228 or by e-mail at manager@a2ct.org. Additional information is available at a2ct.org. 
The workshops on January 14 begin with an introduction to technical theater, followed by sessions on lighting design, sound design, and set design. The workshops on January 21 feature sessions on stage management, props design, hair and makeup design, and costume design. There will be a lunch break from noon-12:30 each Saturday, and participants staying for afternoon sessions are invited to bring a lunch or purchase pizza for $5.
name: Intro to Stagecraft Workshops

description:
Start the new year off right on our new day for poetry on the FOURTH Tuesday or the month at Sweetwaters Coffee & Tea. Whether you’re a page poet, slammer, performance artist or refuse a label, we want to hear your new stuff on our open mic. We look forward to sharing great poetry (and great coffee) with you and invite you to join this free open mic and monthly reading series!


Sign up! 7:00 p.m.

7:15 p.m. – Open mic
8:00 p.m. – Featured Readers

This month's feature: NANDI COMER!

Nandi Comer received a joint MFA/MA in Poetry and African American and African Diaspora Studies at Indiana University. She has received fellowships from the Callaloo Creative Writing Workshop, Cave Canem, Vermont Studio Center, and Virginia Center for the Arts. Her poems and essays have appeared or are forthcoming in To Light a Fire: 20 Years with the InsideOut Literary Arts Project (Wayne State University Press, 2014), Detroit Anthology (Rust Belt Chic Press, 2014), Callaloo, Crab Orchard Review, Green Mountains Review, Pluck!, Prairie Schooner, and Southern Indiana Review. She is a recipient of a 2016 Write A House Permanent Residency in Detroit award.


Next month: MONICA RICO!
name: Skazat! Poetry Series featuring Nandi Comer

description:
Ann Arbor Restaurant Week is your opportunity to try as many great Ann Arbor restaurants as your schedule allows for one incredibly low fixed price.

Vinology Wine Bar and Restaurant is proud to be part of this great event, offered from January 15 - 20.  Enjoy a three course dinner for only $28!
name: Ann Arbor Restaurant Week

description:
We'd love for you to join us for Ann Arbor Restaurant Week, January 15th-20th. Click the link to view our lunch and dinner options for two. We have vegetarian, vegan, and gluten free options.

Also, $.50 from each Restaurant Week meal purchased at the brewpub will be donated to Food Gatherers!

http://www.annarborrestaurantweek.com/…/arborbrewingcompany/
name: Ann Arbor Restaurant Week at Arbor Brewing Company

description:
Restaurant Week is your opportunity to try as many great Ann Arbor restaurants as your schedule allows for one incredibly low fixed price. $15 for lunch and $28 for a three course dinner with many restaurants offering 2 for 1 pricing!

Check out www.annarborrestaurantweek.com for participating restaurants and menu offerings!

description:
Dreaming of a vacation? Come join us at Carson’s for our Taste of Paradise chef-inspired 4-course dinner served in our toasty warm glass room!  

Carson’s American Bistro
Taste of Paradise 
4-Course Chef-Inspired Dinner 

Wednesday, January 25, 2017
6PM | $39.95 (tax/tip not included)
www.carsonsamericanbistro.com/taste-of-paradise

THE MENU

FIRST COURSE
Coconut Shrimp 
with orange marmalade rum sauce
Cranberry Margatini

SECOND COURSE
Jerk Chicken Cobb Salad
Key West jerk marinated chicken, Applewood smoked bacon, avocado, tomato, bleu cheese crumbles & honey mustard dressing
Ranger IPA

THIRD COURSE
Carson’s “Moonshine” Burger
bourbon glazed beef patty topped with bourbon onions, bacon, cheddar cheese, lettuce & tomato 
Carson’s Rum Punch 

FOURTH COURSE
Key Lime Pie
topped with a dollop of crème fraiche 
Grand Traverse Riesling 

Reservations Required
(888) 456-3463 (DINE)
Carson’s American Bistro 
2000 Commonwealth Blvd.  
Ann Arbor, MI 48105 
Phone (888) 456-3463 (DINE)
www.carsonsamericanbistro.com
name: Taste of Paradise Chef's Dinner
